resident:
STUDY:
 [MR CERVICAL SPINE W AND WO IV CONTRAST; MR THORACIC SPINE W AND WO IV CONTRAST; MR LUMBAR SPINE W AND WO IV CONTRAST];  [12/28/2024 12:21 pm; 12/28/2024 12:22 pm; 12/28/2024 12:23 pm]

INDICATION:
 [Signs/Symptoms:evaluate cord compression; Signs/Symptoms:eval cord compression].  []

COMPARISON:
[CT lumbar spine 12/27/2024. CT chest abdomen and pelvis 05/09/2022.]

ACCESSION NUMBER(S):
 [UH0009401524; UH0009401525; UH0009401526]

ORDERING CLINICIAN:
 [ARIEL SINDEL]

TECHNIQUE:
 [Sagittal T1, T2, STIR, axial T1 and axial T2 weighted images were acquired through the cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine.] [Postcontrast imaging was obtained after the administration of 12 mL Dotarem.]

FINDINGS:
CERVICAL SPINE: 



Alignment: [The vertebral alignment is within normal limits.] 



Vertebrae/Intervertebral Discs: There is an enhancing mass involving the C1 vertebral body measuring 4.9 x 7.1 x 2.4 cm (AP x TV x CC) and partially extends into the superior aspect of the C2 vertebral body in addition to the soft tissues surrounding C2. This enhancing mass extends 0.8 cm into the anterior aspect of the spinal canal, worse on the left than the right. Mass also extends 0.4 cm into the posterior aspect of the spinal canal, worse on the left than the right. There is an enhancing lesion at the right aspect of C6/C7 vertebral bodies measuring 1.9 x 1.1 x 1.4 cm (AP x TV x CC). [The vertebral bodies demonstrate expected height.] [Multilevel degenerative endplate changes without associated marrow edema.] [Multilevel loss of normal disc T2 signal intensity and disc height.]



Cord: [The enhancing mass at C1/C2 causes marked compression of the spinal canal and cord at this level. There is cord T2 and STIR hyperintensity consistent with cord edema.] []



C1-C2: [Marked spinal canal stenosis at C1-C2 by the enhancing mass as described above. Associated cord edema.]



C2-C3: [Minimal posterior disc osteophyte complex with indentation of the ventral thecal sac.] [No spinal canal narrowing. Moderate right neural foraminal narrowing. There may also be mild compression of the exiting nerve roots by the soft tissue component surrounding the C2 vertebral body.]



C3-C4: [Mild posterior disc osteophyte complex with indentation of the ventral thecal sac. Uncovertebral hypertrophy most prominent on the right.] [No spinal canal narrowing. Moderate bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.]



C4-C5: [Disc osteophyte complex causing mild spinal canal narrowing. Facet hypertrophy and uncovertebral hypertrophy.] [Severe bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.]



C5-C6: [Disc osteophyte complex causing mild spinal canal narrowing. Mild uncovertebral hypertrophy.] [Mild left neural foraminal narrowing.]



C6-C7: [Disc osteophyte complex causing mild-to-moderate spinal canal narrowing. Bilateral facet hypertrophy and uncovertebral hypertrophy.] [Severe bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.]



C7-T1: [There is no posterior disc contour abnormality.] [No spinal canal narrowing.] Mild right neural foraminal narrowing. 



 [The prevertebral and posterior paraspinous soft tissues are within normal limits.] []





THORACIC SPINE: 

Alignment: [Within normal limits.]



Vertebrae/Intervertebral Discs: Enhancing T2 hyperintense, T1 isointense lesion in the posterior aspect of the T12 vertebral body measuring 1.8 cm most consistent with a vertebral hemangioma. [The vertebral body heights are intact.]  [Marrow signal is within normal limits.] [Mild multilevel degenerative changes of the visualized thoracic spine with bridging osteophytes.] [There is no significant central canal stenosis.] []



Cord: [Normal in signal.] []



[There is no evidence of bulging or herniated disc. There is no evidence of canal or foraminal stenosis.]



The visualized paraspinal soft tissues within the chest are normal.





LUMBAR SPINE: 

[There are 5 lumbar-type vertebral bodies, the last well-formed disc space is labeled L5-S1.]



Alignment: [The vertebral alignment is maintained.] 



Vertebrae/Intervertebral Discs: [There is approximately 50% vertebral body height loss involving the L4 vertebral body, likely chronic given the lack of marrow edema.] [Multilevel degenerative endplate changes.] Multilevel bilateral facet enhancement most prominently involving L3-L4, L4-L5, and L5-S1. There is avid enhancement involving the right L5 pedicle/facet joint at the site of previously seen soft tissue mass. [Multilevel loss of normal disc T2 signal intensity and disc height.]



Conus Medullaris: [The lower thoracic cord appears unremarkable.] The conus terminates at [the superior endplate of L1]. The cauda equina is unremarkable.



T12-L1: [] [No spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.]



L1-2: [Mild indentation of the ventral thecal sac by disc bulge. Right-greater-than-left facet hypertrophy.] [No spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.]



L2-3: [Mild disc bulge with mild spinal canal narrowing. Bilateral facet hypertrophy.] [Mild right neural foraminal narrowing.]



L3-4: [Mild disc bulge and left-greater-than-right facet hypertrophy causing moderate left lateral recess narrowing.] [Mild right neural foraminal narrowing.]



L4-5: [Disc bulge, compression deformity and bilateral facet hypertrophy causing moderate spinal canal stenosis.] [Severe bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.]



L5-S1: [Bilateral facet hypertrophy. No spinal canal narrowing.] [Moderate bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.]



[Mild fatty atrophy of the paraspinous muscles. Otherwise,] [the prevertebral and posterior paraspinous soft tissues are unremarkable.] []



Innumerable cysts throughout the bilateral kidneys 

IMPRESSION:
CERVICAL SPINE: 

[Enhancing mass involving the C1-C2 vertebral bodies causing marked compression of the spinal cord with associated cord edema at this level as described above. 

Enhancing lesion of the right aspect of the C6/C7 vertebral bodies.

Additional mild-to-moderate spinal canal narrowing at C6-C7 with varying degrees of neural foraminal narrowing as described above.

THORACIC SPINE:

Mild multilevel degenerative changes of the visualized thoracic spine without evidence of spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

LUMBAR SPINE: 

Multilevel bilateral facet enhancement likely related to severe degenerative changes. However there is also avid enhancement along the L5 pedicle/facet joint at site of previously seen soft tissue mass. Findings may relate to an active malignancy or posttreatment related degenerative changes. 

Chronic compression deformity of the L4 vertebral body with severe bilateral neural foraminal narrowing at L4-L5. ]

I personally reviewed the images/study and I agree with the findings as stated by Charit Tippareddy, MD. This study was interpreted at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio. 

MACRO:
[

[] [Charit Tippareddy] discussed the significance and urgency of this critical finding [by secure chat] with [] [ANNIE ZHANG] on [12/28/2024] at [2:14 pm].  (**-RCF-**)

Findings:  [See findings].

[]

]

INDICATION:

COMPARISON:
 [None.]

ACCESSION NUMBER(S):
 [UH0009250482]

ORDERING CLINICIAN:
 [BRIAN YOUNG]

TECHNIQUE:
 [The brain was studied in the sagittal, axial and coronal planes utilizing FLAIR, T1 and T2 weighted images. Axial diffusion weighted imaging was obtained.]  []

FINDINGS:
Parenchyma: [There is no diffusion restriction abnormality to suggest acute infarct.] [Nonspecific T2/FLAIR hyperintensities consistent with chronic small vessel ischemic changes. Otherwise, there is no focal parenchymal signal abnormality.] [There is no mass effect or midline shift.] [Gradient echo T2 weighted images fail to demonstrate hemosiderin deposition or other evidence of hemorrhage.] [Mineralization within the bilateral basal ganglia.]



CSF Spaces: [The ventricles, sulci and basal cisterns are within normal limits.]



Paranasal Sinuses and Mastoids: [Left-greater-than-right mastoid effusions. Visualized paranasal sinuses are clear.]



Orbits: Unremarkable appearance of the bilateral orbits.

IMPRESSION
[There is no evidence of mass, cerebral infarction or hemorrhage.]

Nonspecific T2/FLAIR hyperintensities consistent with chronic small-vessel ischemic changes. 

[I personally reviewed the images/study and I agree with the findings as stated. This study was interpreted at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio.]

resident:
STUDY:
 [XR PEDIATRIC AP CHEST ABDOMEN; XR ABDOMEN 1 VIEW];  [12/28/2024 5:25 pm; 12/28/2024 6:26 pm]

INDICATION:
 [Signs/Symptoms:abdominal distension with increasing FiO2 requirements; Signs/Symptoms:decubitus film, liver (right) side up].

COMPARISON:
 [Radiograph 12/26/2024.]

ACCESSION NUMBER(S):
 [UH0009404983; UH0009405439]

ORDERING CLINICIAN:
 [RITA RYAN]

FINDINGS:
 [AP radiograph of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis was provided.] Lateral decubitus radiograph was taken at 6:26 p.m.. 



 [Enteric tube is visualized coursing beneath the diaphragm with the tip [overlying the gastric body.]]



CARDIOMEDIASTINAL SILHOUETTE:

 [Cardiomediastinal silhouette is normal in size and configuration.]



LUNGS:

[Mild diffuse granular opacities bilaterally. No pleural effusions or pneumothorax.]



ABDOMEN:

 [Diffuse gaseous distention of small and large bowel loops with overall nonobstructive bowel-gas pattern. No evidence of pneumoperitoneum or portal venous gas.]



BONES:

 [No acute osseous changes.]

IMPRESSION:
 [Enteric tube with tip overlying gastric body.

Mild diffuse granular opacities bilaterally.

Nonobstructive bowel-gas pattern without evidence of pneumoperitoneum or portal venous gas.] 

[I personally reviewed the images/study and I agree with the findings as stated by Charit Tippareddy, MD. This study was interpreted at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio.]

attending:
STUDY:
 [MR BRAIN W AND WO IV CONTRAST];  [12/15/2024 9:39 pm]

INDICATION:
 [Signs/Symptoms:encephalopathy, hx aml]. []

COMPARISON:
 [None.]

ACCESSION NUMBER(S):
 [UH0009229167]

ORDERING CLINICIAN:
 [REBECCA KLISOVIC]

TECHNIQUE:
 [The brain was studied in the sagittal, axial and coronal planes utilizing FLAIR, T1 and T2 weighted images. Axial diffusion weighted imaging was obtained.] [Post contrast T1 weighted images were acquired after administration of [20 mL] gadolinium based intravenous contrast.] []

FINDINGS:
Limited evaluation on postcontrast imaging due to significant motion artifact. 



Parenchyma: [Tiny punctate foci of diffusion restriction abnormalities in the right frontal lobe and corona radiata.] [Focus of encephalomalacia in the right occipital lobe likely from a prior infarct.] [There is no mass effect or midline shift.] [Gradient echo T2 weighted images fail to demonstrate hemosiderin deposition or other evidence of hemorrhage.] [Motion degraded postcontrast evaluation demonstrates no abnormal enhancement.]



CSF Spaces: [There is slight prominence of the cortical sulci and sylvian fissures. There is mild ventricular dilatation, proportional to the degree of age-related volume loss.]



Paranasal Sinuses and Mastoids: [Minimal mucosal thickening in the right maxillary sinus. Effusions in the bilateral mastoid air cells. Remaining visualized paranasal sinuses are unremarkable.]



Orbits: Unremarkable appearance of the bilateral orbits.

IMPRESSION
[Tiny punctate foci of scattered diffusion restriction abnormalities in the right frontal lobe and corona radiata consistent with punctate foci of acute/subacute infarcts.

Bilateral mastoid air cell effusions.]

[I personally reviewed the images/study and I agree with the findings as stated. This study was interpreted at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio.]

]

 [MR BRAIN W AND WO IV CONTRAST; MR CERVICAL SPINE W AND WO IV CONTRAST];  [12/15/2024 10:33 pm]

TECHNIQUE:
 [The brain was studied in the sagittal, axial and coronal planes utilizing FLAIR, T1 and T2 weighted images. Axial diffusion weighted imaging was obtained.] 

 [Sagittal T1, T2, STIR, axial T1 and axial T2 weighted images were acquired through the cervical spine.]

[Post contrast T1 weighted images were acquired after administration of [12 mL] gadolinium based intravenous contrast.] []

FINDINGS:
Limited examination due to patient motion artifact. 



Brain MRI: 



Parenchyma: [There is no diffusion restriction abnormality to suggest acute infarct.] [Redemonstration of periventricular T2 FLAIR hyperintensities with foci of cystic gliosis in the subcortical region of the left frontal lobe. Findings are overall similar compared to prior examination.] [There is no mass effect or midline shift.] [Gradient echo T2 weighted images demonstrate susceptibility artifact within the left thalamus consistent with mineralization/hemosiderin deposition which is unchanged from prior examination.] [Mild-to-moderate global parenchymal volume loss.] No evidence of abnormal intracranial enhancement within the motion limited images. 



CSF Spaces: [There is mild prominence of the cortical sulci and sylvian fissures. There is mild ventricular dilatation, proportional to the degree of age-related volume loss.]



Paranasal Sinuses and Mastoids: [Mild mucosal thickening of the left maxillary sinus and scattered right ethmoid air cells. Minimal fluid in the right mastoid air cells.]



Orbits: Unremarkable appearance of the bilateral orbits.





Cervical spine MRI: 

Alignment: [Mild grade 1 anterolisthesis of C4 on C5 similar to prior.] 



Vertebrae/Intervertebral Discs: [The vertebral bodies demonstrate expected height.] [The marrow signal is within normal limits.] [The intervertebral discs demonstrate expected signal and morphology.] 



Cord: [Redemonstration of patchy T2 stir hyperintensities throughout the cervical spinal cord most prominent at C2 through C4 which appears similar compared to prior examination.] [Questionable area of subtle enhancement involving the anterior spinal cord at the C2 level which appears overall less conspicuous compared to prior examination dated 10/06/2024.]



C1-C2: [The cervicomedullary junction appears unremarkable.] [There is no central canal stenosis.]



C2-C3: [There is no posterior disc contour abnormality.] [There is no significant central canal or neural foraminal stenosis.] 



C3-C4: [Minimal posterior disc osteophyte complex with thickened ligamentum flavum causing minimal spinal canal stenosis. No neural foraminal stenosis.]  



C4-C5: [There is no posterior disc contour abnormality. Mild ligamentum flavum thickening.] [There is no significant central canal or neural foraminal stenosis.] 



C5-C6: [Minimal posterior disc osteophyte complex with thickened ligamentum flavum causing minimal spinal canal stenosis. No neural foraminal stenosis.] 



C6-C7: [Minimal posterior disc osteophyte complex with thickened ligamentum flavum causing minimal spinal canal stenosis. No neural foraminal stenosis.] 



C7-T1: [Minimal posterior disc osteophyte complex.] [There is no significant central canal or neural foraminal stenosis.]



[The upper thoracic vertebrae and spinal canal are unremarkable.]



[The prevertebral and posterior paraspinous soft tissues are within normal limits.] []

IMPRESSION
Examination is mildly limited due to patient motion artifact. Within these limitations: 

[Similar appearance of periventricular T2 FLAIR hyperintensities with areas of cystic gliosis consistent with patient's known multiple sclerosis.

Similar areas of T2 STIR hyperintensities throughout the cervical spinal cord also compatible with patient's known demyelinating disease.

Questionable area of subtle enhancement involving the anterior spinal cord at the C2 level which appears overall less conspicuous compared to prior examination dated 10/06/2024.]

[I personally reviewed the images/study and I agree with the findings as stated. This study was interpreted at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio.]

MACRO:
[None.]

FINDINGS:
Examination mildly limited due to patient motion artifact. 



Parenchyma: [There is no diffusion restriction abnormality to suggest acute infarct.] [There is no focal parenchymal signal abnormality.] [There is no mass effect or midline shift.] [Gradient echo T2 weighted images demonstrate punctate areas of scattered susceptibility artifact predominantly within the bilateral frontal and parietal lobes in addition to few foci in the splenium of the corpus callosum.] 



CSF Spaces: [The ventricles, sulci and basal cisterns are within normal limits.]



Paranasal Sinuses and Mastoids: [Visualized paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are unremarkable.]



Orbits: Unremarkable appearance of the bilateral orbits.

IMPRESSION
[Punctate areas of scattered susceptibility artifact predominantly within the bilateral frontal and parietal lobes in addition to few foci in the splenium of the corpus callosum. Findings are nonspecific but may represent areas of calcification/microhemorrhage. 

Otherwise, there is no evidence of mass, cerebral infarction or hemorrhage.]

[I personally reviewed the images/study and I agree with the findings as stated. This study was interpreted at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio.]

 [UH0009282515]

ORDERING CLINICIAN:
 [STEVEN SHEIN]

TECHNIQUE:
 [The brain was studied in the sagittal, axial and coronal planes utilizing FLAIR, T1 and T2 weighted images. Axial diffusion weighted imaging was obtained.] [Post contrast T1 weighted images were acquired after administration of [16 mL] gadolinium based intravenous contrast.] []

FINDINGS:
Examination mildly limited due to patient motion artifact. 



Parenchyma: [There is no diffusion restriction abnormality to suggest acute infarct.] [There is no focal parenchymal signal abnormality.] [There is no mass effect or midline shift.] [Gradient echo T2 weighted images demonstrate punctate areas of scattered susceptibility artifact predominantly within the bilateral frontal and parietal lobes in addition to few foci in the splenium and left genu of the corpus callosum.] 



CSF Spaces: [The ventricles, sulci and basal cisterns are within normal limits.]



Paranasal Sinuses and Mastoids: [Visualized paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are unremarkable.]



Orbits: Unremarkable appearance of the bilateral orbits.



Venous sinuses are patent. 

IMPRESSION
[Punctate areas of scattered susceptibility predominantly within the bilateral frontal and parietal lobes in addition to few foci in the splenium and left genu of the corpus callosum. Findings are nonspecific but may represent areas of microhemorrhage possibly associated with history of lymphoproliferative disease, possible small cavernomas though no definitive associated enhancement is appreciated, or hypertensive encephalopathy. Diffuse axonal injury may have a similar appearance though unlikely given lack of history of trauma. 

Otherwise, there is no evidence of mass, cerebral infarction or hemorrhage.] No findings to suggest PRES. No evidence of dural venous sinus thrombosis. 

[I personally reviewed the images/study and I agree with the findings as stated. This study was interpreted at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio.]

MACRO:
[None.]
